information.name: Nintendo Novel Nook
information.description: Immerse yourself in the fantastical worlds of gaming and storytelling at Nintendo Novel Nook. Uncover hidden gems and classic favorites inspired by beloved video game franchises. Whether you're a Mario aficionado, a Zelda enthusiast, or a Pokémon trainer, embark on epic literary adventures that capture the magic of Nintendo.

product.title: Super Mario Encyclopedia
product.author: Nintendo
product.description: Super Mario Bros. Encyclopedia: The Official Guide to the First 30 Years is jam-packed with content from all seventeen Super Mario games

product.title: The Essential Handbook for Nintendo Switch
product.author: Mortimer Children's Books
product.description: It's filled with everything a Switch owner needs to know

product.title: The Legend of Zelda Encyclopedia
product.author: Nintendo
product.description: The Legend of Zelda is one of the most successful franchises of all time with nearly twenty video games and thirty years of history, but it all started with a gold cartridge...

product.title: Disrupting the Game: From the Bronx to the Top of Nintendo
product.author: Reggie Fils-Aimé

product.title: Console Wars: Sega Vs Nintendo
product.author: Blake Harris
product.description: In 1990 Nintendo had a virtual monopoly on the video game industry. Sega, on the other hand, was a faltering arcade company with big aspirations and even bigger personalities.

product.title: The NES Encyclopedia
product.author: Chris Scullion
product.description: The NES is one of the most iconic video game systems of all time, and is credited with ‘saving’ the American video games industry in the early 80s when it looked likely to collapse.

product.title: The Art of Super Mario Odyssey
product.author: Cathy Ballou Mealey

product.title: The Big Book of Nintendo
product.author: Future Publishing Ltd
product.description: Explore Nintendo's journey from an obscure Kyoto-based company to global videogaming powerhouse through some of their most iconic games and consoles.

product.title: The N64 Encyclopedia
product.author: Chris Scullion
product.description: The fourth book in Chris Scullion’s critically acclaimed series of video game encyclopedias, The N64 Encyclopedia is dedicated to the Nintendo 64, one of the most well-loved games consoles ever released.

product.title: Seeing Red: Nintendo's Virtual Boy
product.author: Jose P. Zagal
product.description: The curious history, technology, and technocultural context of Nintendo’s short-lived stereoscopic gaming console, the Virtual Boy.
